data.chText: 保险丝；熔断器
data.enText: a small wire or device inside a piece of electrical equipment that breaks and stops the current if the flow of electricity is too strong

data.chText: 换保险丝
data.enText: to change a fuse

data.chText: 检查一下保险丝是否烧断了。
data.enText: Check whether a fuse has blown.

data.chText: 导火线；导火索
data.enText: a long piece of string or paper which is lit to make a bomb or a firework explode
fuze

data.chText: 引信；信管；雷管
data.enText: a device that makes a bomb explode when it hits sth or at a particular time

data.chText: 他把引信设定为三分钟起爆。
data.enText: He set the fuse to three minutes.

data.chText: 炸弹内装有一小时起爆的引信。
data.enText: The bombs inside were on a one-hour fuse.
blow a fuse

data.chText: 大怒；暴跳如雷
data.enText: to get very angry
have/be on a short fuse

data.chText: 动辄发火；性情暴躁；脾气不好
data.enText: to have a tendency to get angry quickly and easily

data.chText: 对付十几岁的半大孩子，你可能动不动就会生气。
data.enText: You may find your temper on a short fuse when confronting your teenager.

data.chText: （使）融合，熔接，结合
data.enText: when one thing fuses with another, or two things fuse or are fused , they are joined together to form a single thing

data.chText: 骨头愈合时将会连接在一起。
data.enText: As they heal, the bones will fuse together.

data.chText: 我们不同的想法融合成一项计划。
data.enText: Our different ideas fused into a plan.

data.chText: 精子与卵子结合开始受精过程。
data.enText: The sperm fuses with the egg to begin the process of fertilization.

data.chText: 两家公司合并成一个机构。
data.enText: The two companies have been fused into a single organization.

data.chText: 氢原子可熔合成氦。
data.enText: Atoms of hydrogen are fused to make helium.

data.chText: （使）熔化
data.enText: when a substance, especially metal, fuses , or you fuse it, it is heated until it melts

data.chText: （使保险丝熔断而）停止工作
data.enText: to stop working or to make sth stop working because a fuse melts

data.chText: 保险丝烧断，灯都灭了。
data.enText: The lights have fused.

data.chText: 我把照明保险丝烧断了。
data.enText: I've fused the lights.

data.chText: 在（电路或电器）中安装保险丝
data.enText: to put a fuse in a circuit or in a piece of equipment

data.chText: 这个插头有没有安装保险丝？
data.enText: Is this plug fused?

means: 在（电路或电器）中安装保险丝

ex.chText: 玻璃在什么温度下会熔化？
ex.enText: At what temperature can the glass melt?

synonyms.bx: 指物质由固体变成液体。

ex.enText: Don't dissolve the tablet in water.

synonyms.bx: 指某种固体物质溶解于液体中。

ex.chText: 通过熔合铜和锌可以得到黄铜。
ex.enText: Brass can be made by fusing copper and zinc.
Which metal will fuse at a low temperature?

synonyms.bx: 尤指在高温下石头、金属等熔为液体。

ex.enText: The lake thawed early this year.

data.enText: blow a fuse

data.chText: 大怒；暴跳如雷
data.enText: to get very angry
have/be on a short fuse

data.chText: 动辄发火；性情暴躁；脾气不好
data.enText: to have a tendency to get angry quickly and easily

data.chText: 对付十几岁的半大孩子，你可能动不动就会生气。
data.enText: You may find your temper on a short fuse when confronting your teenager.

tr: any igniter that is used to initiate the burning of a propellant
an electrical device that can interrupt the flow of electrical current when it is overloaded
make liquid or plastic by heating
example: The storm fused the electric mains

tr: become plastic or fluid or liquefied from heat
example: The substances fused at a very high temperature

value.def: A fuse is a safety device in an electric plug or circuit. It contains a piece of wire which melts when there is a fault so that the flow of electricity stops.

example.ex: The fuse blew as he pressed the button to start the motor...
example.tran: 他按下按钮启动马达的时候保险丝烧断了。

example.ex: Remove the circuit fuse before beginning electrical work.
example.tran: 开始电工作业之前取下电路保险丝。

value.def: When an electric device fuses or when you fuse it, it stops working because of a fault.

example.ex: The wire snapped at the wall plug and the light fused...
example.tran: 墙上插座的电线短路烧断了保险丝，电灯跟着灭了。
雨水引发保险丝烧熔，使得灯泡都不亮了。

value.tran: (使)(电器等)因保险丝熔断而停止工作

value.def: A fuse is a device on a bomb or firework which delays the explosion so that people can move a safe distance away.

example.ex: A bomb was deactivated at the last moment, after the fuse had been lit.
example.tran: 炸弹在导火索已经点燃的最后一刻被解爆了。

value.def: When things fuse or are fused, they join together physically or chemically, usually to become one thing. You can also say that one thing fuses with another.

example.ex: The skull bones fuse between the ages of fifteen and twenty-five...
example.tran: 头骨在 15 至 25 岁之间长合。

example.ex: Conception occurs when a single sperm fuses with an egg...
example.tran: 受孕发生在单个精子与卵子结合的时候。

example.ex: Manufactured glass is made by fusing various types of sand...
example.tran: 人造玻璃是将各种不同类型的沙子熔合在一起制成的。

example.ex: Their solution was to isolate specific clones of B cells and fuse them with cancer cells...
example.tran: 他们的解决方案是分离出特定的B细胞克隆，然后将它们和癌细胞结合。

example.ex: The flakes seem to fuse together and produce ice crystals.
example.tran: 雪花好像融合在一起形成了冰晶。

value.def: If something fuses two different qualities, ideas, or things, or if they fuse, they join together, especially in order to form a pleasing or satisfactory combination.

example.ex: His music fused the rhythms of jazz with classical forms...
example.tran: 他的音乐把爵士乐的节奏和古典乐的形式结合在了一起。

example.ex: What they have done is fuse two different types of entertainment, the circus and the rock concert...
example.tran: 他们所做的就是把马戏表演和摇滚音乐会这两种不同类型的娱乐形式糅合了起来。

value.tran: (使)(不同特质、思想等)合二为一，合为一体

value.def: If you blow a fuse, you suddenly become very angry and are unable to stay calm.

example.ex: For all my experience, I blew a fuse in the quarter-final and could have been sent off.
example.tran: 尽管已经是老经验了，我还是在四分之一决赛的时候按捺不住发了脾气，差点就被罚出场。

value.def: If someone or something lights the fuse of a particular situation or activity, they suddenly get it started.

example.ex: Hopes for an early cut in German interest rates lit the market's fuse early on.
example.tran: 对德国很快将会降低利率的期望使得市场早早启动了。

value.def: If you say that someone has a short fuse or is on a short fuse you mean that they are quick to react angrily when something goes wrong.

example.ex: I have a very short fuse and a violent temper.
